text: Not sure if this is the right channel to ask, but was wondering if it's possible to implement a Blog template with multiple pages. I can see that in Settings you can designate a separate template for the List page vs. the Detail page, but would it be possible to implement a design like the one attached where different post categories have their own list views?
you could either separate by tags or by using a different blog for each category.  then you could add each in their own loop within a module.

Two questions here:
1. If each category is a separate blog, is it possible to have a main "root" blog that grabs latest 3 posts from the other blogs?
2. If we use tags, how would we navigate from this main blog master list page to the tag-specific page?

1. you can add multiple blogs into a loop. 
2. you can develop a blog page for tagged.  you can see in the docs.  not in a place to link to it, but i promise it is there
So I'm sure there's HubL around pulling tags. My question is more around literal URL navigation. How can I physically link to a new page from a blog template?
the tagged page will have an url something like this `/blog/tag/tag-name`
hope i am sending you in the correct directino :slightly_smiling_face:
Got it, so using the Post Filter module it seems? <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-general/how-can-i-allow-visitors-to-filter-my-blog-posts-by-tag-author-or-month>
The part I'm still struggling through, and sorry if I'm misunderstanding your suggestion, is that I still don't know how to put that post filter module on a new page with a separate URL?
I need to be able to apply custom design and styling to that page
and `/blog/tag/tag-name` feels auto-generated
that will redirect to the same list view template
make a page.  put a module that has the blog loop that you want it then you will have complete control over the url :slightly_smiling_face:

oh great, for some reason I thought only Blog Templates can include blog modules in them, but looks like I can create a regular Page Template and use the same Blog modules inside it, which definitely would solve the problem.

Do you happen to know what the difference is then between a Blog Template and a Page Template?
From a quick look, it looks like the `Blog Content` module is not available on Post Templates

Check out this link <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/printing-sets-of-blog-posts-on-page-templates|https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/printing-sets-of-blog-posts-on-page-templates>
Blog a page template are different. You are looking for modules here
thanks a lot, all of this helped
No worries!  Yell if you need more. Sorry for disjointed replies. Typing on a phone is no good
You're good, appreciate all the advice.
